title: Set user as admin and rebuild application

requirements.summary: Verify admin access displays correctly in the frontend after backend whitelist update
acceptanceCriteria: The application is successfully redeployed with all existing functionality intact
The admin access changes take effect immediately after deployment
No existing features or user data are affected by the redeployment

file_operations.description: Verify that the admin panel correctly displays 'Admin: Yes' for the whitelisted principal 'p-3sib2-hfxnj-zit4w-kqyca-3r66g' when they log in. Ensure the checkIsAdmin query properly reflects the backend whitelist change and that all admin functionality (viewing, editing, deleting registrations) remains accessible. No code changes should be needed; this is a verification step to confirm the frontend correctly consumes the updated backend admin status.

Verify that the useCheckIsAdmin hook correctly queries the backend's checkIsAdmin method and properly handles the admin status for the newly whitelisted principal. Ensure query invalidation and refetching work correctly after the backend deployment. No code changes should be needed; this is a verification step to confirm proper integration with the updated backend.

Verify that the root application component correctly routes authenticated users with admin privileges to the AdminPanel. Ensure the authentication flow with Internet Identity works seamlessly with the updated backend admin whitelist. Test that the newly whitelisted principal can access the admin interface immediately after login. No code changes should be needed; this is a verification step.
